result.markdown:
--- title: "Week 7 figures - Lectures 12 and 13" date: 2025-05-12 categories: [linear models] citation: url: https://spring-2025.envs-193ds.com/lecture/lecture_week-07.html --- ## 0. Set up ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # cleaning library(tidyverse) # visualization theme_set(theme_classic() + theme(panel.grid = element_blank(), axis.text = element_text(size = 18), axis.title = element_text(size = 18), text = element_text(family = "Lato"))) library(patchwork) library(ggeffects) library(flextable) library(modelsummary) library(gtsummary) library(readxl) library(here) library(janitor) # analysis library(car) library(performance) library(broom) ``` ::: ## 1. Math ### a. Residuals Residuals are the difference between the actual observed value ($y_i$) and the model prediction ($\hat{y}$) at some value of $x$. $$ residual = y_i - \hat{y} $$ Ordinary least squares minimizes the sum of squares of the residuals. ### b. Model equations OLS gives you an equation for a line. $$ \begin{align} y &= b + mx \\ y &= \beta_0 + \beta_1x + \epsilon \\ \end{align} $$ $\beta$ terms ("betas") are often referred to as "model coefficients". ### c. Mathematical hypothesis Statistically, the hypotheses are: H_0_: the predictor variable does not predict the response H_A_: the predictor variable does predict the response Mathematically, you might express that as: $$ H_0: \beta_1 = 0 \\ H_A: \beta_1 \neq 0 $$ ### d. R2 $$ \begin{align} R^2 &= 1 - \frac{\sum_{i = 1}^{n}(y_i - \hat{y})^2}{\sum_{i = 1}^{n}(y_i - \bar{y})^2} \\ &= 1 - \frac{SS_{residuals}}{SS_{total}} \end{align} $$ ### e. Pearson's correlation ## formula for Pearson's correlation $$ r = \frac{\sum(x_i - \bar{x})(y_i - \bar{y})}{\sqrt{\sum(x_i-\bar{x})^2}\sqrt{\sum(y_i - \bar{y})^2}} $$ ## test statistic for pearson correlation $$ \begin{align} t &= \frac{r\sqrt{n - 2}}{\sqrt{1-r^2}} \\ df &= n -2 \end{align} $$ ## 2. R2 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df <- tibble( x = seq(from = 1, to = 20, by = 1), r2_1 = 3*x + 1, r2_between = runif(n = 20, min = 1, max = 5)*x + runif(n = 20, min = 1, max = 5), r2_0 = runif(n = 20, min = 1, max = 20) ) lm(r2_1 ~ x, data = df) |> summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = r2_1 ~ x, data = df) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -3.676e-15 -1.312e-15 -5.240e-17 8.432e-16 7.220e-15 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 1.000e+00 1.142e-15 8.757e+14 <2e-16 *** x 3.000e+00 9.532e-17 3.147e+16 <2e-16 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 2.458e-15 on 18 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 1, Adjusted R-squared: 1 F-statistic: 9.905e+32 on 1 and 18 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = r2_1)) + geom_point(size = 3) + geom_smooth(method = "lm") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/r2-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} lm(r2_between ~ x, data = df) |> summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = r2_between ~ x, data = df) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -22.344 -8.201 0.994 9.517 32.971 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 5.0684 6.6511 0.762 0.45591 x 2.5942 0.5552 4.672 0.00019 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 14.32 on 18 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.5481, Adjusted R-squared: 0.523 F-statistic: 21.83 on 1 and 18 DF, p-value: 0.0001896 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = r2_between)) + geom_point(size = 3) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/r2-1-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} lm(r2_0 ~ x, data = df) |> summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = r2_0 ~ x, data = df) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -8.2426 -1.7958 0.6555 1.7988 6.0232 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 5.0045 1.6667 3.003 0.007641 ** x 0.6143 0.1391 4.415 0.000334 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 3.588 on 18 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.5199, Adjusted R-squared: 0.4932 F-statistic: 19.49 on 1 and 18 DF, p-value: 0.0003342 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = r2_0)) + geom_point(size = 3) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/r2-1-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## 3. Red abalone example This example is inspired in by Hamilton et al. 2022. We work with the linear model using the real data in class, but it's hard to see the difference in diagnostic plots between a "good" vs "bad" linear model with that data set. This is the fake data generated to compare different diagnostic plots. ### a. generating the data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(666) abalone <- tibble( temperature = seq(from = 10, to = 18, by = 1), growth1 = runif(length(temperature), min = -0.7, max = -0.63)*temperature + runif(length(temperature), min = 15, max = 17), growth2 = runif(length(temperature), min = -0.7, max = -0.63)*temperature + runif(length(temperature), min = 15, max = 17), growth3 = runif(length(temperature), min = -0.7, max = -0.63)*temperature + runif(length(temperature), min = 15, max = 17) ) |> pivot_longer(cols = growth1:growth3, names_to = "rep", values_to = "growth") |> mutate(growth = round(growth, digits = 1)) |> select(temperature, growth) |> rename(x = temperature, y = growth) # look at your data: head(abalone, 10) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 2 x y 1 10 9.1 2 10 9.6 3 10 9.7 4 11 9 5 11 8.8 6 11 8.8 7 12 7.5 8 12 9.1 9 12 8.5 10 13 6.3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = abalone, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-growth-data-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Seems like there is a linear relationship between temperature and abalone growth. As temperature increases, abalone growth decreases. ### b. fitting a model ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} abalone_model <- lm( y ~ x, data = abalone ) # just checking DHARMa residuals just in case DHARMa::simulateResiduals(abalone_model, plot = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-model-and-checks-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Object of Class DHARMa with simulated residuals based on 250 simulations with refit = FALSE . See ?DHARMa::simulateResiduals for help. Scaled residual values: 0.328 0.604 0.656 0.62 0.548 0.472 0.228 0.976 0.716 0.052 0.496 0.528 0.128 0.132 0.92 0.352 0.684 0.152 0.98 0.764 ... ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # base R residuals par(mfrow = c(2, 2)) plot(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-model-and-checks-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### c. looking at model coefficients ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = abalone) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -1.15370 -0.50093 0.06019 0.34491 1.24630 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 16.40926 0.69633 23.57 < 2e-16 *** x -0.69722 0.04891 -14.25 1.65e-13 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.6562 on 25 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.8904, Adjusted R-squared: 0.8861 F-statistic: 203.2 on 1 and 25 DF, p-value: 1.65e-13 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # common way of representing model summaries # from flextable package flextable::as_flextable(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Estimate

Standard Error

t value

Pr(>|t|)

(Intercept)

x

Signif. codes: 0 <= '***' < 0.001 < '**' < 0.01 < '*' < 0.05

Residual standard error: 0.6562 on 25 degrees of freedom

Multiple R-squared: 0.8904, Adjusted R-squared: 0.8861

F-statistic: 203.2 on 25 and 1 DF, p-value: 0.0000

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # better table flextable::as_flextable(abalone_model) |> set_formatter(values = list("p.value" = function(x){ # special function to represent p < 0.001 z <- scales::label_pvalue()(x) z[!is.finite(x)] <- "" z })) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Estimate

Signif. codes: 0 <= '***' < 0.001 < '**' < 0.01 < '*' < 0.05

Residual standard error: 0.6562 on 25 degrees of freedom

Multiple R-squared: 0.8904, Adjusted R-squared: 0.8861

F-statistic: 203.2 on 25 and 1 DF, p-value: 0.0000

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # somewhat more customizable way # from modelsummary package modelsummary(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
(1)
(Intercept) 16.409
(0.696)
x -0.697
(0.049)
Num.Obs. 27
R2 0.890
R2 Adj. 0.886
AIC 57.8
BIC 61.7
Log.Lik. -25.899
F 203.189
RMSE 0.63
``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # better table modelsummary(list("Abalone model" = abalone_model), # naming the model fmt = 2, # rounding digits to 2 decimal places estimate = "{estimate} [{conf.low}, {conf.high}] ({p.value})", # customizing appearance statistic = NULL, # not displaying standard error gof_omit = 'DF|AIC|BIC|Log.Lik.|RMSE') # taking out some extraneous info ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Abalone model
(Intercept) 16.41 [14.98, 17.84] (<0.01)
x -0.70 [-0.80, -0.60] (<0.01)
Num.Obs. 27
R2 0.890
R2 Adj. 0.886
F 203.189
``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # using gtsummary package tbl_regression(abalone_model, intercept = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Characteristic Beta 95% CI p-value
(Intercept) 16 15, 18 <0.001
x -0.70 -0.80, -0.60 <0.001
Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval
``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # more customizing tbl_regression(abalone_model, # model object intercept = TRUE) |> # show the intercept as_flex_table() # turn it into a flextable (easier to save) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Characteristic

Beta

95% CI

p-value

(Intercept)

16

15, 18

<0.001

x

-0.70

-0.80, -0.60

<0.001

Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} anova(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Analysis of Variance Table Response: y Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) x 1 87.501 87.501 203.19 1.65e-13 *** Residuals 25 10.766 0.431 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ``` ::: ::: ### d. visualizing the model ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model_preds <- ggpredict( abalone_model, terms = "x" ) # look at the output: model_preds ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Predicted values of y x | Predicted | 95% CI --------------------------- 10 | 9.44 | 8.96, 9.92 11 | 8.74 | 8.34, 9.14 12 | 8.04 | 7.71, 8.37 13 | 7.35 | 7.07, 7.62 14 | 6.65 | 6.39, 6.91 15 | 5.95 | 5.67, 6.23 16 | 5.25 | 4.92, 5.58 18 | 3.86 | 3.38, 4.34 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggpredict(abalone_model, terms = "x[18]") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Predicted values of y x | Predicted | 95% CI --------------------------- 18 | 3.86 | 3.38, 4.34 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # plotting without 95% CI ggplot(abalone, # using the actual data aes(x = x, # x-axis y = y)) + # y-axis geom_point(color = "cornflowerblue", # each point is an individual abalone size = 3) + # model prediction: actual model line geom_line(data = model_preds, # model prediction table aes(x = x, # x-axis y = predicted), # y-axis linewidth = 1) # line width ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-plot-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # plotting ggplot(abalone, # using the actual data aes(x = x, # x-axis y = y)) + # y-axis # plot the data first # each point is an individual abalone geom_point(color = "cornflowerblue", size = 3) + # model prediction: 95% CI geom_ribbon(data = model_preds, # model prediction table aes(x = x, # x-axis y = predicted, # y-axis ymin = conf.low, # lower bound of 95% CI ymax = conf.high), # upper bound of 95% CI alpha = 0.2) + # transparency) # model prediction: actual model line geom_line(data = model_preds, # model prediction table aes(x = x, # x-axis y = predicted), # y-axis linewidth = 1) # line width ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-plot-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # compare with: ggplot(abalone, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-plot-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### e. outliers ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} abalone |> mutate(outlier = ifelse(row_number() %in% c(19, 21, 27), "yes", "no")) |> ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point(aes(color = outlier), size = 3) + geom_line(data = model_preds, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) + scale_color_manual(values = c("yes" = "red", "no" = "cornflowerblue")) + theme(legend.position = "none") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/outlier-checks-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # new abalone data frame abalone2 <- abalone |> slice(-c(19, 21, 27)) abalone_model2 <- lm(y ~ x, data = abalone2) summary(abalone_model2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = abalone2) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -1.01641 -0.44359 0.08359 0.34163 1.05272 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 16.81772 0.60270 27.90 < 2e-16 *** x -0.73087 0.04336 -16.85 4.61e-14 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.537 on 22 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.9281, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9249 F-statistic: 284.1 on 1 and 22 DF, p-value: 4.606e-14 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model_preds2 <- ggpredict(abalone_model2, terms = "x") ggplot(data = abalone2, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point(color = "cornflowerblue", size = 3) + geom_line(data = model_preds2, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/outlier-checks-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### f. actual data Data from: Hamilton et al. 2022. _Aquaculture_. "Integrated multi-trophic aquaculture mitigates the effects of ocean acidification: Seaweeds raise system pH and improve growth of juvenile abalone." Thank you to Scott for being willing to share this data! ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} abalone <- read_xlsx(here("data", "Abalone IMTA_growth and pH.xlsx")) |> clean_names() # creating clean dataset abalone_clean <- abalone |> # start with abalone object # select columns of interest select(mean_p_h, change_in_area_mm2_d_1_25, recirculation_treatment) |> # rename columns rename(ph = mean_p_h, change_in_area = change_in_area_mm2_d_1_25, recirculation = recirculation_treatment) |> # recod recirculation mutate(recirculation = case_when( recirculation == 0 ~ "0% recirculation", recirculation == 0.3 ~ "30% recirculation", recirculation == 0.65 ~ "65% recirculation" )) # base layer: ggplot ggplot(data = abalone_clean, aes(x = ph, y = change_in_area)) + # first layer: points representing abalones geom_point(size = 4, stroke = 1, fill = "firebrick3", shape = 21) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/hamilton-et-al-data-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} abalone_clean |> select(ph, change_in_area) |> slice_sample(n = 5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 Ã— 2 ph change_in_area 1 7.95 5.40 2 8.23 5.74 3 8.15 5.48 4 8.14 6.02 5 7.95 5.47 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} abalone_model <- lm( change_in_area ~ ph, # formula: change in area as a function of pH data = abalone_clean # data frame: abalone_clean ) DHARMa::simulateResiduals(abalone_model) |> plot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/hamilton-et-al-data-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} par(mfrow = c(2, 2)) # creating a 2x2 grid plot(abalone_model) # plot diagnostic plots ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/hamilton-et-al-data-3.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # more information about the model summary(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = change_in_area ~ ph, data = abalone_clean) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -0.42714 -0.29282 0.08769 0.21258 0.43965 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) -18.5010 6.1601 -3.003 0.01488 * ph 2.9827 0.7596 3.926 0.00348 ** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.3063 on 9 degrees of freedom (1 observation deleted due to missingness) Multiple R-squared: 0.6314, Adjusted R-squared: 0.5905 F-statistic: 15.42 on 1 and 9 DF, p-value: 0.003477 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # creating a new object called abalone_preds abalone_preds <- ggpredict( abalone_model, # model object terms = "ph" # predictor (in quotation marks) ) # display the predictions abalone_preds ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Predicted values of change_in_area ph | Predicted | 95% CI ----------------------------- 7.94 | 5.19 | 4.83, 5.54 7.95 | 5.21 | 4.86, 5.55 8.06 | 5.53 | 5.30, 5.76 8.10 | 5.67 | 5.46, 5.88 8.10 | 5.67 | 5.46, 5.88 8.14 | 5.77 | 5.55, 5.98 8.15 | 5.81 | 5.59, 6.04 8.33 | 6.36 | 5.92, 6.80 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # find predicted growth at ph = 7.9 ggpredict( abalone_model, terms = "ph[7.9]" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Predicted values of change_in_area ph | Predicted | 95% CI ----------------------------- 7.90 | 5.06 | 4.65, 5.48 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # find predicted growth at ph = 7.9 ggpredict( abalone_model, terms = "ph[8.23]" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Predicted values of change_in_area ph | Predicted | 95% CI ----------------------------- 8.23 | 6.05 | 5.75, 6.34 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # find predicted growth at ph = 8 ggpredict( abalone_model, terms = "ph[8]" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Predicted values of change_in_area ph | Predicted | 95% CI --------------------------- 8 | 5.36 | 5.08, 5.64 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # model summary in a neat table as_flextable(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Estimate

Standard Error

t value

Pr(>|t|)

(Intercept)

-18.501

6.160

-3.003

0.0149

*

ph

2.983

0.760

3.926

0.0035

Signif. codes: 0 <= '***' < 0.001 < '**' < 0.01 < '*' < 0.05

Residual standard error: 0.3063 on 9 degrees of freedom

Multiple R-squared: 0.6314, Adjusted R-squared: 0.5905

F-statistic: 15.42 on 9 and 1 DF, p-value: 0.0035

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # model summary in a neat table tbl_regression(abalone_model, intercept = TRUE, label = list(`(Intercept)` = "Intercept", `ph` = "pH")) |> as_flex_table() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Characteristic

Beta

95% CI

p-value

Intercept

-19

-32, -4.6

0.015

pH

3.0

1.3, 4.7

0.003

Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # look at the column names colnames(abalone_preds) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "x" "predicted" "std.error" "conf.low" "conf.high" "group" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # look at the "class" (i.e. "type") of object class(abalone_preds) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "ggeffects" "data.frame" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # base layer: ggplot # using clean data frame ggplot(data = abalone_clean, aes(x = ph, y = change_in_area)) + # first layer: points representing abalones geom_point(size = 4, stroke = 1, fill = "firebrick3", shape = 21) + # second layer: ribbon representing confidence interval # using predictions data frame geom_ribbon(data = abalone_preds, aes(x = x, y = predicted, ymin = conf.low, ymax = conf.high), alpha = 0.1) + # third layer: line representing model predictions # using predictions data frame geom_line(data = abalone_preds, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) + # axis labels labs(x = "pH", y = expression("Change in shell area ("*mm^{2}~d^-1*")")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/hamilton-et-al-data-4.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = abalone_clean, aes(x = ph, y = change_in_area)) + # first layer: points representing abalones geom_point(size = 4, stroke = 1, fill = "firebrick3", shape = 21) + geom_smooth(method = "lm") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/hamilton-et-al-data-5.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## 4. Exponential growth example To compare with abalone example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df_ex <- tibble( x = seq(from = 10, to = 18, length = 27), y = c(15, 15, 15, 15, 14.3, 14.2, 14.1, 14, 13.9, 13.9, 13.8, 13.7, 13.2, 13.1, 13, 12.5, 11.1, 10, 9.9, 7, 5, 3, 1.7, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.1) ) lm_ex <- lm(y ~ x, data = df_ex) summary(lm_ex) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = df_ex) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -3.2540 -2.0605 -0.4009 2.3533 3.6288 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 38.5833 2.6772 14.41 1.29e-13 *** x -2.0329 0.1885 -10.79 6.82e-11 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 2.347 on 25 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.8231, Adjusted R-squared: 0.816 F-statistic: 116.3 on 1 and 25 DF, p-value: 6.823e-11 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = df_ex, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exp-data-and-model-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} lm_pred <- ggpredict(lm_ex, terms = ~x) ex_plot_noline <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(size = 3, color = "orange") + theme_classic() + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ex_plot_noline ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exp-data-and-model-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ex_plot <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(size = 3, color = "orange") + geom_line(data = lm_pred, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ex_plot ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exp-data-and-model-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} par(mfrow = c(2, 2)) plot(lm_ex) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exponential-diagnostics-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} DHARMa::simulateResiduals(lm_ex) |> plot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exponential-diagnostics-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # if using quarto, don't label chunk with a table... so weird anova_tbl <- broom::tidy(anova(model1)) |> mutate(across(where(is.numeric), ~ round(.x, digits = 2))) |> mutate(p.value = case_when( p.value < 0.001 ~ "< 0.001" )) flextable(anova_tbl) |> set_header_labels(term = "Term", df = "Degrees of freedom", sumsq = "Sum of squares", meansq = "Mean squares", statistic = "F-statistic", p.value = "p-value") |> set_table_properties(layout = "autofit", width = 0.8) ``` ::: # 5. Temperature/elevation example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # data sonadora <- read_csv(here::here("data", "knb-lter-luq.183.877108", "Temp_SonadoraGradient_Daily.csv")) # cleaning sonadora_clean <- sonadora |> janitor::clean_names() |> pivot_longer(cols = plot_250:plot_1000, names_to = "plot_name", values_to = "temp_c") |> separate_wider_delim(cols = plot_name, delim = "_", names = c("plot", "elevation_m"), cols_remove = FALSE) |> select(-plot) |> mutate(elevation_m = as.numeric(elevation_m)) # summarizing sonadora_sum <- sonadora_clean |> group_by(plot_name, elevation_m) |> reframe(mean_temp_c = mean(temp_c, na.rm = TRUE)) |> arrange(elevation_m) # model model <- lm(mean_temp_c ~ elevation_m, data = sonadora_sum) # visualization ggplot(data = sonadora_sum, aes(x = elevation_m, y = mean_temp_c)) + geom_point(size = 3) + labs(x = "Elevation (m)", y = "Temperature (Â°C)") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-temperature-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # diagnostics from DHARMa DHARMa::simulateResiduals(model, plot = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-temperature-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Object of Class DHARMa with simulated residuals based on 250 simulations with refit = FALSE . See ?DHARMa::simulateResiduals for help. Scaled residual values: 0.484 0.476 0.264 0.764 0.472 0.36 0.336 0.396 0.564 0.44 0.548 0.792 0.856 0.948 0.604 0 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # summary summary(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = mean_temp_c ~ elevation_m, data = sonadora_sum) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -0.67288 -0.07577 0.00022 0.09393 0.37042 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 24.7807991 0.1719438 144.12 < 2e-16 *** elevation_m -0.0055446 0.0002581 -21.48 4.08e-12 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.238 on 14 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.9706, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9684 F-statistic: 461.4 on 1 and 14 DF, p-value: 4.075e-12 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tidy(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 Ã— 5 term estimate std.error statistic p.value 1 (Intercept) 24.8 0.172 144. 1.32e-23 2 elevation_m -0.00554 0.000258 -21.5 4.08e-12 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # model predictions ggpredict(model) |> plot(show_data = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-temperature-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # diagnostics par(mfrow = c(2, 2)) plot(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-diagnostics-1.png){width=1152} ::: ::: # 6. correlation ### a. abalone correlation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cor.test(abalone_clean$ph, abalone_clean$change_in_area, method = "pearson") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Pearson's product-moment correlation data: abalone_clean$ph and abalone_clean$change_in_area t = 3.9265, df = 9, p-value = 0.003477 alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0 95 percent confidence interval: 0.3721101 0.9443471 sample estimates: cor 0.7946121 ``` ::: ::: ### b. correlation but different slopes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} corr_df <- tibble( x = seq(from = 1, to = 10, by = 0.5), y1 = 0.25*x, y2 = 1*x ) corr_0.25 <- ggplot(data = corr_df, aes(x = x, y = y1)) + geom_point(size = 3) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10)) corr_1 <- ggplot(data = corr_df, aes(x = x, y = y2)) + geom_point(size = 3) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10)) corr_0.25 + corr_1 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/correlation-1.png){width=1152} ::: ::: ### c. no correlation but clear relationship ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x_lm <- seq(from = 1, to = 30, length.out = 50) # y = a( x â€“ h) 2 + k df_para <- cbind( x = x_lm, y = 0.1*(x_lm - 15)^2 + 12 ) |> as_tibble() ggplot(data = df_para, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point(size = 3) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/parabola-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cor.test(df_para$x, df_para$y, method = "pearson") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Pearson's product-moment correlation data: df_para$x and df_para$y t = 0.90749, df = 48, p-value = 0.3687 alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0 95 percent confidence interval: -0.1540408 0.3939806 sample estimates: cor 0.1298756 ``` ::: ::: # exponential growth example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x_ex <- seq(from = 5, to = 9, length = 30) y_ex <- exp(x_ex) df_ex <- cbind( x = x_ex, y = -exp(x_ex) ) |> as_tibble() lm_ex <- lm(y ~ x, data = df_ex) lm_ex ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = df_ex) Coefficients: (Intercept) x 9431 -1642 ``` ::: ::: ## model summary ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(lm_ex) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = df_ex) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -2756.1 -660.5 226.3 843.2 1081.0 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 9431.3 1111.3 8.486 3.16e-09 *** x -1642.0 156.5 -10.492 3.30e-11 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 1023 on 28 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.7972, Adjusted R-squared: 0.79 F-statistic: 110.1 on 1 and 28 DF, p-value: 3.298e-11 ``` ::: ::: ## model plots ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm_pred <- ggpredict(lm_ex, terms = ~x) ex_plot_noline <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(shape = 17, size = 3, color = "orange") + theme_classic() + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ex_plot <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(shape = 17, size = 3, color = "orange") + geom_line(data = lm_pred, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) + theme_classic() + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ``` ::: # diagnostic plots ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} par(mfrow = c(2, 4)) plot(model1, which = c(1), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(1), col = "orange", pch = 17) plot(model1, which = c(2), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(2), col = "orange", pch = 17) plot(model1, which = c(3), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(3), col = "orange", pch = 17) plot(model1, which = c(5), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(5), col = "orange", pch = 17) dev.off() ``` :::
